New Records: Sri Lanka's 170/10 (19.2) is a low total in a T20I match against India, with India's 213/7 (20) being a competitive score
Key Match Events: Riyan Parag took three wickets off just eight deliveries he bowled in the match
Arshdeep Singh got Kusal Mendis out, and then Riyan Parag bowled the last two batters on consecutive deliveries in the 20th over to restrict Sri Lanka to 170 runs
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka have won the toss and have opted to field
India's Axar Patel and Arshdeep Singh also grabbed a brace of wickets
Post-Match Reflections: Charith Asalanka said they were not up to the mark in the powerplay, but in the latter part, they came back pretty strong
Suryakumar Yadav said India were fortunate that there was no dew, and the way they played in the World Cup, that remedied us that the game was still too far
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch looked good and might get slower once the ball loses its hardness
The wind is blowing and the atmosphere is cool and pleasant
